Area of Effect: 30-ft. radius|speed_factor = 4|hands = 2-handed}}'''Carsomyr''', also known as''' The Holy Avenger''', is a powerful two-handed sword which can only be wielded by non-evil alignment [[paladin]]s, this limits the use of the weapon to a paladin [[Gorion's Ward]], [[Keldorn Firecam|Keldorn]], or those with access to [[Use Any Item]]. == Carsomyr +5 == === Acquisition === In {{BGIISoA}}(SoA){{BGIIEESoA}}(SoA), it can be obtained by slaying the red dragon [[Firkraag]] in [[Domain of the Dragon]]. ===Description=== {{quote|Carsomyr is a weapon of legend, perhaps one of the most powerful blades ever forged on Faerûn, though its origin and history is thought purposefully forgotten so that the sword itself shall never overshadow the importance of the struggles that must be fought today. It is infused with the very essence of virtue, and requires as much from any Paladin that would hope to wield it. The evils of the realms must truly stand aside when this weapon is brought to bear, their magic dispelled with a word, steadfastly resisted with ease. Carsomyr also harbors a special distaste for the forces of evil and chaos, and such creatures must fear additional damage from its touch in battle. }} ==Carsomyr +6== === Acquisition === In {{BGIIToB}}{{BGIIEESoA}}(ToB), [[Cespenar]] can upgrade Carsomyr +5 to its +6 version if the protagonist is willing to use the [[Eye of Tyr]] and spend {{gp|5,000}}. ===Description=== {{quote|Carsomyr is a weapon of legend, perhaps one of the most powerful blades ever forged on Faerun, though its origin and history is thought purposefully forgotten, such that the sword itself never overshadow the importance of the struggles that must be fought today. It is infused with the very essence of virtue, and requires as much from any paladin that would hope to wield it. The evils of the Realms must truly stand aside when this weapon is brought to bear, their magic dispelled with a word, steadfastly resisted with ease. Carsomyr also harbors a special distaste for the forces of evil and chaos, and such creatures must fear additional damage from its touch in battle.
